body:
I've got a couple of questions wrt to this bug:
 - Does this happen only with decorations set to `none`?
 - What's your `startup_mode` in the config? Windowed?
 - Does this same issue happen when running XWayland?

* Sorry, decorations is set to `full` and this bug does not happen on `none`
* Yes, `startup_mode` is `Windowed`
* Both on GNOME on Xorg and XWayland this issue does not appear

Also one thing I have noticed
On Wayland the title bar is plain white rectangle (with minimize, maximize and close buttons), while on Xorg/XWayland the bar looks the same as in other programs

issue.title: Fullscreen state and restore size not tracked correctly on GNOME Wayland

labels.name: DS - wayland
labels.description: Affects the Wayland backend, or generally free Unix platforms

labels.name: C - needs investigation
labels.description: Issue must be confirmed and researched

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
It seems like there are two problems with fullscreen on GNOME Wayland:
 - The first set_fullscreen is ignored, it is required to set it to false and then true again to make it work
 - When leaving fullscreen mode, the original window size is not restored

This does not happen when the decorations are disabled, only with the decorations active.

Maybe this is a bug in GNOME with how winit decorations are handled?

It was originally reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/3831.

body:
>  On Wayland the title bar is plain white rectangle (with minimize, maximize and close buttons), while on Xorg/XWayland the bar looks the same as in other programs

That's intended, it's due to GNOME Wayland not having server-side decorations.

> Sorry, decorations is set to full and this bug does not happen on none

This applies to both issues, right?

I've submitted an issue upstream in https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/1601.
Yes, this applies to both issues
ToggleFullscreen also does not bring back the decorations when toggling back to windowed mode

Fiddling with ToggleFullscreen (going fullscreen, then windowed, resizing and going fullscreen again) crashes the terminal
```
soveu@localhost ~> alacritty 
thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /builddir/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/winit-0.22.2/src/platform_impl/linux/wayland/window.rs:398:22
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
soveu@localhost ~ [101]> alacritty --version
alacritty 0.4.3
```
EDIT: crash happens if toggling back to windowed mode made the window lose its decorations
Looks like ToggleFullscreen always leaves a gap at the bottom of screen when going from windowed with decorations to fullscreen

I noticed that snapping (not sure if that is the right term) the window to one side of my desktop does not resize the render buffer either. Manually resizing window by dragging its border fixes it.

This might be the same bug as this problem?

> Looks like ToggleFullscreen always leaves a gap at the bottom of screen when going from windowed with decorations to fullscreen

That is most likely this winit bug: https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/1509

> I noticed that snapping (not sure if that is the right term) the window to one side of my desktop does not resize the render buffer either. Manually resizing window by dragging its border fixes it.
> 
> This might be the same bug as this problem?

Exactly
